FOUND IN: Athena - Ancient Greek goddess of wisdom, courage, and warfare.
Volcano - A natural landform characterized by an opening in Earth's crust through which lava, ash, and gases are ejected.
Vagrant - A person with no settled home or regular employment, typically wandering from place to place.
Leech - An annelid worm known for feeding on the blood of its host.

CLUE: Prison formerly standing on site of the Old Bailey
FOUND IN: Newgate - A notorious prison in London, known historically as the location of the Old Bailey before it became a courthouse.
Plover - A small wading bird in the family Charadriidae, resembling lapwings.
Gnat - A small flying insect related to midges or mosquitoes; some gnats are also known as bloodsucking biters.
John Lennon (died in 1980) - Known for his influence even after his untimely death, he had a lasting impact on music and culture during this decade.
